headline: Parmesan-Crusted Shrimp Scampi with Pasta
description: Parmesan-crusted shrimp are paired with a garlic and white wine sauce and angel hair pasta for a next-level shrimp scampi dish that's easy and delicious.
name: Parmesan-Crusted Shrimp Scampi with Pasta
recipeIngredient: 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
0.75 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Heat 1/4 cup butter over medium heat in a large, deep skillet. Add garlic; cook and stir until fragrant. Add shrimp, white wine, and lemon juice; continue to cook and stir until shrimp is bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 5 minutes. Stir in red pepper flakes until well combined. Remove from heat and set aside.
Place remaining 1/4 cup butter, bread crumbs, 1/2 the Parmesan cheese, and parsley in a bowl. Stir until well combined. Set aside.
Place cooked pasta into shrimp scampi mixture; toss until fully coated in sauce. Add remaining Parmesan cheese and toss well. Top with bread crumb mixture.
Broil in the preheated oven until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: My husband is on meds and he thought something was off. It’s his taste buds that are off, it was awesome. If you don’t like spicy, I’d go with 1/2 tsp red pepper. Also, I am not a cook. It would have been great to know and not have to look up, how much dry pasta is 2 cups and I used lemon juice and had to look up that 2 tablespoons of juice is in one medium lemon.
Consider using 1.5x butter & wine to make some extra sauce. I did 3 mins under broiler. Very nice dish,
I added a package of (sliced) cherry tomatoes, ITALIAN SEASONING, fresh cut chives (1/4 cup) and chopped rest basil. Served with grated Parmesan cheese. Success.
Excellent dish!! Thank you!

Made this for my husband and I tonight. He is very picky when it comes to food but he thought this was great. I did not read the reviews before hand and we both thought it was a bit dry but the flavor was delicious! Will be making it again and doubling the sauce!
My husband and I really enjoyed this dish, but have discussed changes we would make the next time - and there will be a next time!
Delicious, will definitely make again.

This was a great recipe. I had to make a couple substitutions because my husband needs to eat low-carb, used cauliflower pasta and almond flour in place of bread crumbs, otherwise followed the recipe as written. Was very good, will make again.
This recipe has potential but the portions were off. I'm going to try again with about half as much angel hair and twice as much bread crumb mixture.
Absolutely delicious, so much so I’ve made it twice. My husband especially loves it.

I found this to be a little dry but good flavor. Next time I will double the sauce, remove the cooked shrimp and reduce the sauce to thicken a bit. Then add the shrimp back in AFTER tossing the pasta with the sauce. Also used Panko instead of seasoned crumbs.
Also, I’ll put the whole thing into a broiler proof dish before sprinkling on topping.
I followed the recipe exactly and while it was good, it wasn’t great. This will not be on high rotation.
Scrumptious! Thank you for sharing!
Doubled the recipe. Had to add 3xs the liquid and butter and came out excellent. The whole family loved it.
Absolutely delicious! The only thing I would change is the amount of breadcrumbs, as you can see in the picture it is quite alot - I would only use half.
This was very good, but I found it somewhat dry. Next time I will increase the amount of sauce and add more accordingly to my taste. Very flavorful, hubby loved it!

Loved the taste, BUT when adjusting down to 3 people, the ingredients state 1/4 cup of butter and later in the recipe it calls for 1/4 cup twice, I wish it had adjusted correctly, it turned out very dry. I believe with the correct measurements, this would be a fantastic recipe.
Need a better way to gauge volume of pasta. I guessed and it was way too much leaving the dish fairly dry. Good flavor...
Loved it! The blend of flavors were great. I used less shrimp because I could only buy jumbo; not medium. The Parmesan crust topping really finishes the dish!

Took a lot of time to get everything ready. Went together easily once all was ready. I left out the red pepper flakes didn’t have any, I think it would have been a little tastier.

A gas broiler cooks different than electric. Bread crumb coat got real brown in two minutes.

I will try it again.

Way to much lemon. I re-read the recipe several times, it says one lemon juiced. It should probably just be a squeeze of lemon. I also didn't think the breadcrumbs worked with the angel hair, too delicate of a pasta.

It was good. I'll make this again and again. Next time I will remember to add the parmesan to the noodles, instead of the top because I forgot, and I will lower the oven rack so that I don't burn the top.
Great flavors. Broil less, top too crispy. Both of us had seconds although we only make half the recipe. Use less pasta.
Delicious!
It was very good. Easy to make and my family loved it.
This was very good. My guy is not always crazy about shrimp but like this, including seconds. I made big goof and put all cheese in with bread crumbs and pats of butter on top. Still excellent.
Fast and easy to make and really delicious. Merry of kid definitely make it again

We loved this recipe! The flavors just melded together, so if your expecting a creamy flavor this isn’t for you . Will definitely be our new go to recipe ! It was also easy to put together and hardly took any time at all ! Love love love it!

Some of the reviews stated the recipe was too dry and I have to agree. Aside from a sprinkle of bread crumbs on top, I don't see the point of the crumbs, they just suck up the moisture. I think the idea is good, it just needs some tweaking.

I love shrimp scampi
I love angel hair and parm cheese
But I would have rather just mixed it all together on top of stove - I found the "baking" dries out the angel hair to much with the broiler on the crumbs and cheese . It tasted good but too dry
We are keeping this with a few tweaks. 12 oz angel hair pasta is what we'll use. I also substituted chicken broth for 1/2 of the butter. Needed a bit of salt. It is easy and delicious. We like it!

Awesome recipe. We loved this. I also added portabella mushrooms to it and used no wine. I did add more butter for a bit more sauce to it. It still tasted awesome. I did cut the bread crumbs in half and still came out great.

I made the recipe as is. The topping burned a couple seconds after 2 minutes. Next time I will just mix the topping in and serve. The taste was great (after I scraped of most of the burnt crumbs). The addition of crushed red pepper flakes gives it just the right kick. This recipe is definitely a keeper for me.
absolutely amazing! the mis of the bread crumbs and the wine sauce was the perfect mix. family loved it, asked when I am making again!
It is the. Best!!
The recipe is a good basic recipe, but it should be reviewed. No recipe will have a nice flavor without any salt. I think it was a mishap when typing, but salt can NEVER be left out.
Delicious! I used a blend of Italian cheeses, oregano and a good pinot gris. Otherwise, made as directed.Didn't have red pepper flakes, and didn't miss it. My son loved it. Will make it again!
I have made this recipe three times just as it is written by the author. It is just delicious, and quick. Thanks for a great recipe which we really enjoy.
Easy and delicious.

My husband loved it! I made it exactly as directed and for me it was a little bread crumb heavy, but that is part of what hubs loved about it - the texture. Watch the broiling carefully as mine began blackening much faster than 3 minutes and nearly burned. I will definitely make it again!
This was the second time I made!! Scrumptious. The only changes were no salt in the boiling pasta and use of Smart Balance as my butter.
If I made it again I would cut bread crumbs topping in half or skip altogether.
This is quick, easy and tastes amazing!

I made as per the recipe except we don’t buy cooking wine so I substituted with a 50/50 water to white vinegar. The taste was wonderful throughout cooking. But once the breadcrumbs were added, it got so dry we could barely eat it. Next time I will only use a very small amount of the breadcrumb topping or just completely omit it.
This recipe is good but I feel it’s too much bread crumbs and Parmesan and not enough liquid, learned the hard way to cut the bread crumbs and Parmesan in half and double the sauce.

I made this 3 times. The first time went by the recipe except used thin spaghetti and I had no bread crumbs so I crushed up Ritz crackers. It was a little dry, i think because I added too much spaghetti, but still delicious! 2nd time tried it with Italian flavored bread crumbs and it was terrible!! 3rd time well, you know I used the crackers and this time had the Angel hair...it was so good I'm going to have to double the recipe!!!
I made this tonight and thought it turned out great.
It was my wife birthday and I made Parmesan-crusted shrimp for her.Well let me tell you I am the new hero in my house. I have you to thank for it. keep them coming.

My wife and I love this! I have made it twice now and raved about it so much to friends and family that they all asked me to share the recipe with them. Very easy meal for a kitchen rookie like myself to fix.
Dry, dry, dry and the breadcrumbs burned in the broiler.
Very easy & great flavor. I only used 1/2 of crushed red pepper but still had just the right amount of kick.
I didn’t have any white wine so I used cooking sherry instead otherwise I followed the directions . My husband enjoyed it and so did I. I am keeping the recipe.
Dry. No flavor.
Not into it. Won’t make it again.
I have made this recipe twice and have now turned my younger brother onto it as well. Now he’s asked for the recipe. It’s easy to make but seems fancy at the same time. Very enjoyable.
The sauce and shrimp were perfect with out the bread crumbs on top. I poured the sauce and shrimp over the angel hair and it was perfect!!

this was really good! very easy to make and great flavors. my oven must have been a lot hotter though as at 3 minutes the topping was starting to burn. next time I will do for 1.5 minutes. this is definitely a keeper though.
My husband made this for us last night. We absolutely loved it! Might use a little less pasta next time, but this ranks up at the top of new favs!
I thought it was outstanding. I used panko instead of bread crumbs cuz I has it on hand and I used thin spaghetti instead of angel hair cuz I had it as well. Great recipe, thank you!

My husband and I are on the no carb/low carb bandwagon. I substituted spaghetti squash for the angel hair (Stabbed the squash a few times with a knife and microwaved it for 15-20 mins turning it halfway). Delicious! I think it's best to cook this meal in a cast iron skillet if possible.
Followed to the letter, it was great. Next time I will make extra wine sauce.
This recipe is so beyond easy and so flavorful! It comes out exactly the same every time. I double the sauce recipe or else it's a bit dry.
LOVED this!! My boyfriend and I couldn't get enough!
My husband loved it.
Delicious!! Will make it again.
This was wonderful!! The sauce made the pasta just melt in your mouth! I’m going to serve it the next time I have dinner guests.

I cheated, I used frozen, cooked shrimp. It was very tasty but a little dry. I’m not sure why. I love Scampi and it was good not to have it swimming in butter. The lemon and red pepper gave it a great kick. My husband really liked it too.

This is definitely a keeper!! Quick, fairly easy, nice presentation and absolutely delicious! Only had Japanese panko so just added a teaspoon of Italian seasoning which worked beautifully. Topped with shredded Italian cheese blend instead of straight Parmesan. Perfection
needed more liquid for the sauce

This was delicious. We read some of the reviews and took the advice of adding more sauce. We doubled the garlic, added 50% more wine and butter and left the lemon juice the same. We also added a touch of creole seasoning. Our 4 year old loves shrimp and ate an adult sized portion without much fuss. Thanks for a great recipe and great tips.
Not crazy about this one. Taste was good, but texture wasn’t great with the Parmesan on top. Next time I’ll skip that step.
Very good! I added cayenne pepper to the bread crumb mix for a lil kick. Loved it!

While my husband has been recovering from shoulder surgery, it’s been my time to do the cooking. This was my most adventuresome attempt, and it turned out great, even though I let the topping burn a little under the broiler. Even without the yummy shrimp, the pasta would have been great. I followed the recipe exactly.
Use de tailed shrimp. Used 1 teaspoon salt free creole seasoning. Did not use the second ¼ cup of butter to cut down on fat but recipe ended up too dry.
I forgot to pick up red flakes so I used ground chili and Cajun seasoning. I used spaghetti squash instead of angel hair pasta. It is amazing and I will definitely make this again!!!
My husband loves shrimp, but not angel hair pasta, so I made this with rigatoni. It came out perfect! He raved about it. Will make it again.
Absolutely delicious as is. Doubled the recipe for 8 people and it turned out great. I put my too close to the broiler so next time, the rack will be put on the next lower rack.
Great recipe!!! I used chicken stock instead of white cooking wine and it was delicious. I will definitely make this again.

Really enjoyed this. I had 8 big eaters, so made this for 10. Mixed messages in these reviews re how to measure the dry pasta, so I just went with a 16 oz package (per the package, it's 8 servings, but it worked). Doubled everything except sauce, which I increased. I used sauvignon blanc wine. I have a nice big broiler pan and put the entire batch in that when it was set to go, leaving lots of room to top with the bread crumb mixture. Rave reviews!
Delicious!
Made it and will make it again. Easy to make.
It was just great !
I made it with spiraled zucchini was amazing.
We loved it!
Delicious

Super easy dinner to make!!! A great weeknight quick meal. I was able to make it in about 25 minutes.. I think next time I will add bacon because bacon makes so many things better. 100% will be making this again!
Really great! I made this as written and it turned out delicious. Definitely not health food though. We will for sure make this again.
I will make his again.

Made this and loved it.
Added lemon zest from the lemon used for juice and added chicken broth as others suggested(8oz). Three typing takes this to the next level. DH loved it. Added a large handful of power greens when mixing all ingredients together instead of just parsley.
No changes and will definitely make it again. My husband said it was his new favorite!

We thought this was a very good dish. I did adapt it to be gli
Utensils free. I used GF pasta. We also doubled the sauce so the leftovers wouldn’t be too dry.
This recipe is quick and easy. My family loved it.
So easy to make amazing flavor when the best recipes I get out of here on this site so thank you

I did use gluten- free pasta.. otherwise I followed the rest of the recipe-- Very nice flavor, and texture... With shrimp, parmesan cheese, butter and pasta... you can't go wrong! I will be making this again!
Came out great as written!
Delicious.
I made this dish and it was easy. My only concern is that is was dry on the 2nd day. The flavor is spot on.
I made the shrimp and put it over rice instead. It was delicious.
This was delicious and even great as leftovers. The red peppers give it quite a kick so if you don’t want it to be spicy skip the peppers.
